Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION IN ACCOUNTING, ASSOCIATES OF ARTS LEVEL COURSES
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES INTENSIVE COVERAGE OF CURRENT ACCOUNTING PRACTICE AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS RELATED TO LEASES; INCOME TAXES, EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION ISSUES, DERIVATIVES, CONTINGENCIES, BUSINESS SEGMENTS AND INTERIM REPORTS; ACCOUNTING CHANGES AND ERROR CORRECTIONS; FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS; AND INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.  ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES.
2.  ACCOUNTING FOR PENSIONS AND POSTRETIREMENT BENEFITS.
3.  ACCOUNTING FOR LEASES
4.  ACCOUNTING FOR CHANGES AND ERROR ANALYSIS
5.  STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS
6.  FULL DISCLOSURE IN FINANCIAL REPORTING
7.  BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
8.  INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS



1. HAVE AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF ACCOUNTING FOR INVESTMENTS, INCLUDING DERIVATIVES,
2. UNDERSTAND THE BASICS OF ACCOUNTING FOR INTER AND INTRA-PERIOD INCOME TAXES,
3. BE ABLE TO PREPARE REASONABLY COMPLEX STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS,
4. BE MORE AWARE OF THE REQUIREMENTS FOR FULL DISCLOSURE IN U.S. AND INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
